PDPA_INTRO: Nok Airlines Public Company Limited and affiliated companies including individuals involved in the processing of personal data on orders or in its behalf (collectively referred to as "Company") are aware of the importance of Personal Data (defined below) protection of Company's customers and trading and business partners (collectively referred to as "you" or "Data Subject"). The collection, use and/or disclosure (collectively referred to as "Processing" or "Data Processing") of Personal Data shall act in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act B.E. 2562 including other relevant laws as the Personal Data protection is a social responsibility so as to build trust and strong business relations between Company and its customers and trading and business partners. Company hereby announces this Privacy Notice in order to inform you of your rights and legal duties, as well as terms and conditions concerning the collection, use, or disclosure of your Personal Data.
PDPA_PERSONAL_DATA_DEF: The term "Personal Data" means any information relating to a person which enables the identification of such person, whether directly or indirectly, but not including the information of deceased persons in particular.
PDPA_SENSITIVE_DATA_DEF: The term "Sensitive Personal Data" means any information relating to a particular person which is sensitive and presents significant risks to the Person's fundamental rights and freedoms, which includes data regarding racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, cults, religious or philosophical beliefs, sexual behaviour, criminal records, health data, disabilities, trade union information, genetic data and biometric data such as facial data iris simulation data or fingerprint data, etc.
PDPA_COLLECTION_INTRO: Company shall collect Personal Data within the purpose, scope, and lawful and fair methods as is necessary which is defined in the scope of Company's corporate objectives. The Personal Data that Company collects shall include:
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_1: Personal Data, including but not limited to given Personally Identifiable information e.g. Name, age, date of birth, passport and identification card number, signature, copy of identification card, copy of house registration, marriage status, job position, career, affiliation or identifiable official documents, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_2: Contact information, including but not limited to home address, phone number and email address, working address, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_3: Image information, including but not limited to images, motion images of you or your assets, which are collected from CCTV, cameras when entering the Company's area, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_4: Platform user information, including but not limited to user name account, password, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_5: Financial information, including but not limited to bank account number, copy of passbook detail page, data related to credit card, Transaction data includes information about the products you purchase, prices, methods and details of payment, income, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_6: Purchasing products and services information, including but not limited to order history, service & product interests, order number, request number, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_7: Travel information, including but not limited to flight information, hotel information, vehicle information, tour information that you use, information for specific services for special meals, in-flight seat numbers, passenger records, ticket numbers, invoice numbers, etc.;
PDPA_COLLECTION_LIST_8: Information obtained from the company's collection or automation from the company's devices IP Address, Cookie, Service Behaviour, Service History, Voice, Photo, Motion, social media, Chat, Geolocation, etc.
PDPA_CONSENT_INTRO: In this regard, Company shall request consent from Data Subject before such collecting, except for where:
PDPA_CONSENT_LIST_1: it is necessary for the performance of a contract where the collection, use, or disclosure of Personal Data is required to provide service or for performance of a contract between Data Subject and Company;
PDPA_CONSENT_LIST_2: it is to prevent or suppress a danger to a Person's life, body or health;
PDPA_CONSENT_LIST_3: it is necessary for compliance with the law;
PDPA_CONSENT_LIST_4: it is necessary for legitimate interests of Company so as to fulfill its operational objectives in which suitable measures to safeguard Data Subject's rights and freedoms are put in place, including but not limited to fraud prevention, network security and safeguards for Data Subject's rights and freedoms;
PDPA_CONSENT_LIST_5: it is for the achievement of the purpose relating to the preparation of the historical documents or the archives for public interest, or for other purposes relating to research or statistics, in which suitable measures to safeguard Data Subject's rights and freedoms are put in place; and
PDPA_CONSENT_LIST_6: it is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest, or it is necessary for the exercising of official authority.
PDPA_SENSITIVE_CONTENT: Company may be required to collect Sensitive Personal Data from Data Subject, including but not limited to religion, race, biological information (fingerprint and face scan), disability, ethnicity, criminal record. By doing so, Company shall request for explicit consent from Data Subject upon each collecting, using and/or disclosing of such Sensitive Personal Data accordingly, except for where:
PDPA_SENSITIVE_LIST_1: it is to prevent or suppress a danger to a person's life, body or health;
PDPA_SENSITIVE_LIST_2: it is carried out in the course of legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by the foundations, associations or any other not-for-profit bodies with a political, religious, philosophical, or trade union purposes for their members, former members of the bodies, or persons having regular contact with such foundations, associations or not-for-profit bodies in connection with their purposes, without disclosing the Personal Data outside of such foundations, associations or not-for-profit bodies;
PDPA_SENSITIVE_LIST_3: it is information that is disclosed to the public with the explicit consent of Data Subject;
PDPA_SENSITIVE_LIST_4: it is necessary for the establishment, compliance, exercise or defense of legal claims; and
PDPA_SENSITIVE_LIST_5: it is necessary for compliance with the law so as to achieve the purposes with respect to: 5.1. preventive medicine or occupational medicine, the assessment of working capacity of Employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care, medical treatment, the management of health or social care systems and services 5.2. public interest in public health, such as protecting against cross-border dangerous contagious disease or epidemics which may be contagious or pestilent; 5.3. employment protection, social security, national health security, social health welfare of the entitled person by law; 5.4. the scientific, historical, or statistic research purposes, or other public interests; and 5.5. the substantial public interest.
PDPA_SOURCE_LIST_1: Personal Data can be directly obtained from Data Subject through application or other service channels supervised by the Company, enter-exit in the Company, purchase the Company's products or services, seminars, procurements, online and offline transactions, conversation via email, applying for a job, or through other communication channels between the Company and you;
PDPA_SOURCE_LIST_2: Personal Data can be obtained from related third party information, including but not limited to relatives or family members;
PDPA_SOURCE_LIST_3: Personal Data can be obtained from automated system, including but not limited to recordings from CCTV; and
PDPA_SOURCE_LIST_4: Personal Data can be obtained from other sources, including but not limited to public data, partners of Company, government agencies as well as other personal information that users have provided.
PDPA_PURPOSES_INTRO: Company may use Personal Data for the following purposes or for other purposes notified at the time of collecting Personal Data or for which Data Subject has given consent after Company has collected such Personal Data. Reasons for collecting, using or disclosing are provided below:
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_1: to enter into a contract or for the performance of a contract between Company and Data Subject or third party for Data Subject's interests;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_3: to inform and recommend Data Subject about goods, products and services or to publish marketing and promotional materials or other benefits to contact details given by Data Subject upon the consent of Data Subject;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_4: to delivery of products or respond to Data Subject's enquiry and assist Data Subject;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_5: to carry out the business operation, evaluate and improve the quality of goods, products and services of Company
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_6: to carry out any accounting and financial activities; including but not limited to auditing, debt notification and collection, tax operations and transactions as prescribed by law;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_7: for Company's legitimate interests, including but not limited to recordings obtained from CCTV;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_8: for compliance with the Company's regulation;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_9: for applying for a job, being an employee and/or any other related purposes;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_10: to investigate and comply with the laws, regulations, regulations or legal duties of the Company.
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_11: to satisfy Data Subject's demand or needs;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_12: to facilitate and present a list of benefits to service users;
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_13: for marketing, promotion and customer relations, such as sending information about promotions products and services promotional items and business partners.
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_14: to survey feedbacks, analyse, research, and gather statistical data for marketing purposes or in order to develop and improve Company's corporate operations and create new products; and
PDPA_PURPOSES_LIST_15: for other purposes upon the explicit consent from Data Subject.
PDPA_TRANSFER_TITLE: Transferring and Disclosing of Personal Data
PDPA_TRANSFER_INTRO: Company shall not disclose and transfer Personal Data to third party unless explicit consent is given, or except for where:
PDPA_TRANSFER_LIST_1: In order to fulfill and achieve the purposes contemplated in this Privacy Notice, the Company may disclose or share only as necessary to following; 1.1 business partners and business alliances; 1.2 agents or business partners who provide services to the Company or take any action as a representative of the Company, such as a transport service provider, a service provider for archiving and destroying documents. contractors doing marketing activities and advertising media, contractors develops and monitors security and information technology systems, auditors, lawyers, legal or tax advisors, etc.; and 1.3 banks and payment service providers such as credit or debit card companies, etc. service provider or external entities. The Company will enter into a personal data processing agreement as required by law.
PDPA_TRANSFER_LIST_2: Company may disclose or share Personal Data to Company's affiliates; in this regard, the Processing of Personal Data shall merely be in keeping with the purposes contemplated in this Privacy Notice; and
PDPA_TRANSFER_LIST_3: it is required to disclose Personal Data by law or legal procedures or to disclose Personal Data to officers, authorities or authorized organizations in order to comply with lawful order or request.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_INTRO: In some cases, the Company may send the recipient's information to foreign countries such as in the case of the Company communicating with service recipients or external agencies located abroad. If one of the following circumstances is met, the Company will send the recipient's information abroad in either way:
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_1: The destination country or international organisation has determined by the Personal Data Protection Board that there is adequate personal data protection.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_2: Foreign entities are subject to a personal data protection policy that has been reviewed and certified by the Office of the Personal Data Protection Commission.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_3: The Company and foreign agencies can put in place appropriate personal data protection measures to enforce the rights of the personal data subject. It includes effective legal remedies in accordance with the rules and procedures announced by the Personal Data Protection Commission. For example, standard contract clauses, codes of practice, certified standards, etc.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_4: It is necessary for the exercise of legal rights.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_5: You are aware of inadequate personal protection standards of the destination country or international organization that has received personal data.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_6: It is necessary for the performance of the contract to which you are the party or for your request before entering into that contract.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_7: It is an action under a contract between the Company and another person or juristic person for your benefit.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_8: To prevent or suppress harm to the life, body, or health of you or others when you are unable to give consent at that time.
PDPA_INTERNATIONAL_LIST_9: It is necessary for the mission of the important public interest.
PDPA_PROTECTION_CONTENT: Company has provided and adopted Personal Data storage system equipped with appropriate mechanism and technical features by encrypting the transferring of Personal Data via internet network, as well as safeguard measures in accordance with the law concerning the protection of Personal Data and relevant relegations. Company also restricts its employees, contractors and representatives from accessing to the use, disclosure, destroying or unauthorized access of Personal Data.
PDPA_RETENTION_CONTENT: Company shall retain and use Personal Data as long as necessary for the purposes of Processing Personal Data contemplated in this Privacy Notice or as prescribed by law, except for where it is necessary to retain such Personal Data for other reasons, including but not limited to acting in accordance with the law, to fulfilling Company's legal duties and obligations or to inspecting in case where any disputes arise. Under such circumstances, Company may retain Personal Data longer than the abovementioned period.
PDPA_CHANGES_CONTENT: Company may amend this Privacy Notice or parts of it and will inform you of the respective amendments or changes to this Privacy Notice as well as the recent date of such amending on www.nokair.com, Company suggests you regularly check this Privacy Notice. By using products or service on Company's website after the amending of this Privacy Notice, you are deemed to acknowledge such amending or changes.
PDPA_RIGHTS_INTRO: Data Subject may exercise Data Subject Rights with respect to the data protection law and as contemplated in this Privacy Notice, details as specified below:
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_1: Right to access and obtain copy of Data Subject's Personal Data;
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_2: Right to have inaccurate Personal Data rectified, or completed if it is incomplete;
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_3: Right to Data Portability in case where Company has made such Personal Data publicly accessible in the format readable or commonly used by ways of automatic tools or equipment, and can be used or disclosed by automated methods;
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_4: Right to erase, destroy or anonymize Personal Data, should such Personal Data be no longer necessary or unless there are certain circumstances where Company has legal grounds to reject Data Subject's request;
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_5: Right to restrict the use of Personal Data under circumstances where Personal Data is subject to erasure or is no longer necessary;
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_6: Right to withdraw consent given by Data Subject; and
PDPA_RIGHTS_LIST_7: Right to object the Processing of Personal Data at any time.
